respStmt.resp: Transcribed from images of original letters
respStmt.name: Sarah Tew
Giuliano Sidro
Millie You
Maddie Qualls

publicationStmt.distributor: The Center for the Tebtunis Papyri, The University of California, Berkeley
publicationStmt.authority: The Board of Trinity College Dublin, The University of Dublin

availability.p: Available for academic research purposes only.

objectDesc.p: Handwritten letter of 4 pages on one folded sheet with writing on front and back. An additional sheet, is written front and back and added to the the letter proper.
Catalog number "93" written in pencil. Previous number "101" erased and overwritten with "93".

recordHist.p: Images taken from Trinity College, Dublin: Page 1Pages 2-3Page 4Page5Page6

projectDesc.p: This document was created as part of the History of Papyrology project [https://histpap.info/] by Sarah Tew, Giuliano Sidro, Maddie Qualls, and Millie You. The project is in affiliation the Center for Tebtunis Papyri at the University of California, Berkeley.

editorialDecl.p: Text has been transcribed diplomatically without corrections, normalization, or standardization.

punctuation.p: All punction marks have been retained and represented using the appropriate Unicode code character except for apostrophes and ampersands which have been escaped using ' and &, respectively.

segmentation.p: The text has been segmented into lines according to line breaks in the original text automatically by Transkribus and line groupings based on groups identified automatically or manually declared by Sarah Tew in Transkribus. Page breaks have been manually edited by Sarah Tew, Giuliano Sidro, Maddie Qualls, and Millie You after export from Transkribus.

handNotes.handNote: Written in black ink by B.P. Grenfell.

revisionDesc.change: Manually added TEI header to Transkribus tei.xml exported file.

body.ab:
My dear Smyly,
I have looked at the
Damanhûr stele which is a
shortened copy of the hieroglyphics
of the Rosetta, with many
blunders acc. to Bouriant, (whose
edition contains several misprint .)
It is dated in the 23d year of
PEpiphanes, Gorpiaeus 24 = Phar-
mouthi 24. Of that there is no

doubt. My mother who knows
a fair amount of hieroglyphics has
looked at Bouriants text & the
photograph. If there is a mistake
in the name of the months it wou is
more likely to be in the Egyptian than
in the Macedonian, which is written
out in letters Qrpiais, while the Egyptian
is written in the ordinary way
"going out month 4" i.e.
Pharmouthi.
I am sorry that we dont think
either Δαισιου or ενατη possible

readings in the papyrus you saw,
while and I do not understand your
reference of the other papyrus to
Philopatοr Neos. It is clearly
Philometor, and the name of
the ιερεια Αρσινοης Φιλοπατορος
in both agrees with the Rosetta
& Damenhûr inscriptions, showing
she was priestess fr. the 9th of Ptol V
to the 8th of Ptol VII (or VI if
we are to believe Strack).
By the way I am reviewing his
book on the Ptolemies for the Class.

Review. May I refer to the fact
that you are re-editing the P.P.? II
I am going to slate him for treating
Revillout so seriously. For the latter
gentleman we are preparing a
further excursus in our next volume
on the subject of dowry. I think
we can have him, Wessely & Mitteis
on toast.
I enclose copies of the protocols
of the two Amherst papyri. If you
refer to them in print, please call them
Lord A's. We hope to publish his papyri
in 1900.

ε̣̣̣π̣ι̣ . . . . . [ ] . . . . . κανηφορου Αρσινοης Φιλα-
δελφου Σι[. . . . . . . . . . ἱερειας Αρσινοης
Φιλοπατορος Ειρηνης της Πτολεμαιου μηνος Διου ενατη[ι?
και εικαδι Παχων [9letters–11] ε̣ι̣κ̣α̣δ̣ι (4) εν Κροκοδιλων πολει
10 Του Αρσινοιτο[υ νομου
(1) I feel no doubt about ογδοου. It isnt a bit like ενατου or any
of the other numbers up to 10.
(2) The plural shere & in the other pap. must be a mistake due to the other
plurals, as he wasnt^ (according to the ord. theory) married to Cleop. then, or could Cleop. have been
deified with him at an early age? Possibly she was married to him very early
& only put on the protocols as βασιλισσα afterwards?
(3) I cant make anything fit except δευτερου. (4) more like εικαδι than κατηι
B.P.G.

Amherst Papyri
1. Βασιλευοντος Πτολεμαιου του Πτολεμαιου και Κλεοπατρας θεω̣ν̣ επιφανω̣ν̣ ετους ογδο̣ο̣υ̣ (1)
εφ ιερεως Ηρακλειῖου του . . . . φ̣ου Αλεξανδρου και θεωνσωτηρων και θ[εω]ν αλδελ. και θ. ευερ.
και Θ. Φιλοπατ. και θεων επιφανων και θεων φιλομητορων (2) αθλ. Βερεν. Ευεργ. . . . . . .
Κανηφορ. Αρσιν. Φιλαδελφου Α̣ρι̣στ̣ο̣κ ου ιερειας Αρσινοης Φιλοπ.
5 Ειρηνης της Πτολεμαιου μενος Λωιου τρεισκαιδεκατηι Μεχειρ τρεισκαιδεκατηι εν τηι
Σοκνοπαιου Νησωι του Αρισινοιτου νομου.
2. a very cursive & illegible doc. of 19 lines
then
Βασιλευοντ[ο]ς Πτολεμαιον [τ]ου Πτολεμαιου και
Κλεοπατρ[ας] Θεω[ν] επιφανων ετους δ̣ε̣[υ]τερο̣[υ (3)
εφ [ιε]ρεω[ς Π?ο]σε[ι?δ]ω̣νιου του Ποσειδωνιου Αλεξανδρο[υ
και θεων σωτ[ηρων και θε]ων αδελφων και θεων επιφανων και θεων
5 φιλομητορων αθ[λοφορου] Β[ερ]ενικης Ευεργετιδος
please turn overP.T.O.
